physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination revealed facial dysmorphism characterized by midface hypoplasia, flat nasal bridge, hypertelorism, high-arched palate, macroglossia, gum hypertrophy, and enamel hypoplasia. The patient had a deformed chest cage and prominent pigeon chest with scoliosis. Hepatosplenomegaly was observed, along with relatively freely movable extremities but with mild limitation of ROM in most large and small joints. The patient had a widely spaced and unstable gait.
